The normal distribution has the following key properties:
• It is completely described by its mean, pu, and variance, o?, stated as X - N(0, 02).
In words, this says that “X is normally distributed with mean u and variance o?.”
Skewness = 0, meaning that the normal distribution is symmetric about its mean, so
that P(X < 0) = P(u < X) = 0.5, and mean = median = mode.
Kurtosis = 3; this is a measure of how flat the distribution is. Recall that excess
kurtosis is measured relative to 3, the kurtosis of the normal distribution.
A linear combination of normally distributed random variables is also normally
distributed.
The probabilities of outcomes further above and below the mean get smaller and
smaller but do not go to zero (the tails get very thin but extend infinitely).
